DOC.brief_summary: The proposed study is a physiologic investigation of the effects of testosterone on the natriuretic peptide system. The hypotheses of the study are that testosterone administration will decrease natriuretic peptide levels and salt excretion. The entire protocol is 8 weeks in duration.
DOC.brief_title: Testosterone Regulation of the Natriuretic Peptide System
DOC.criteria: Men: aged 18 to 40 years, normal testosterone and free testosterone levels, no history of hypertension, and BMI between 18.5 and 25. Women: aged 18 to 40 years old, regular menstrual periods, negative pregnancy test, no oral contraceptives for â‰¥ 3 mos, no history of hypertension, BMI between 18.5 and 25. Antihypertensives, diuretics or insulin, diabetes mellitus, prior cardiovascular, abnormal liver or renal disease, history of cancer, atrial fibrillation, or abnormal sodium or potassium level.
